definition: to raise the same old topic again/to hark back

sentences.english: We talk everything from history to sports, from latest news to politics.
sentences.chinese: 從歷史聊到體育，從最新舊事聊到政治。

sentences.english: My favorite one is "The Old Story of South Beijing".
sentences.chinese: 我最喜歡的一本是“城南舊事”。
他們舊事重提，揭開了舊的傷痕。

sentences.english: The Six Dynasties, river water, Tianya million mu.
sentences.chinese: 六朝舊事，一江流水，萬感天涯暮。

sentences.english: Then, all of a sudden, some people insisted on bringing the subject up again.
sentences.chinese: 然後，突然之間，一些人又堅持重提舊事。

sentences.english: It was right there in front of you. Why do you want to talk about that again?
sentences.chinese: 自由就在你眼前，你爲何不願再舊事重提？

sentences.english: Don't beat the dead horse. We cleared up that misunderstanding long ago.
sentences.chinese: 不要在重提舊事，很久之前我們就澄清那誤會了。

sentences.english: What do you think of this new vision of the old story?
sentences.chinese: 面對這般舊事新說，您又作何感想呢？

sentences.english: Bringing up a matter of the past, only in order to promote today's introspection.
sentences.chinese: 舊事重提，只爲促進今天的反省。

sentences.english: Are playing a song, old difficult litigation heart words.
sentences.chinese: 皆奏一楓曲，舊事難訟心底言。

sentences.english: We could all have settled down then, minding our own business, and I'd have let bygones be bygones.
sentences.chinese: 原說下接過來大家安分守己的，我也不提舊事了。

sentences.english: Before you how thought and then went without saying, that was yet the not transformable antique matter.
sentences.chinese: 以前你怎麼想就不必說了，那已經是不可改變的舊事。

sentences.english: In the world of mortals, the number of Penglai news, empty back in succession, the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 紅塵中，多少蓬萊舊事，空回首，煙靄紛紛。

definition: to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
a snap of the fingers/a short moment/in a flash/in the twinkling of an eye
wind and rain/the elements/trials and hardships
to destroy/to spoil/to ruin/to injure/cruel/oppressive/savage/brutal/incomplete/disabled/to remain/to survive/remnant/surplus
to examine/to check/to keep a lookout/cautious/restrained (in speech or mannerisms)
object of ridicule/laughingstock/to laugh over sth/to make light chat
